snippet: A study of people under 40 found that higher systolic blood pressure is associated with decreases in the volume of gray matter and significant injury to white matter.
abstract: A study of people under 40 found that higher systolic blood pressure is associated with decreases in the volume of gray matter and significant injury to white matter.

headline.main: High Blood Pressure Tied to Brain Changes
headline.print_headline: Vital Signs | Risks: High Blood Pressure Tied to Brain Changes
